intro: Sakoanala capuroniana, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
